result.execSummary:
The defendant Sterling L Soman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time allowed - eligible for communtiy service under 973.03(3).
Consecutive to: 13CT-30

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sterling L Soman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: In custody FOSO
commitment order
for payment plan

Called 3 pm. All cases 14TR517-14TR518-14TR519-14TR520-13CT30-14CF79 and 14CF106 No appearance by defendant. (in jail) FCC enters default payment of $100 p/mo co 12/2/14. Combine all cases under one payment plan..
for payment plan filed in 14CF131
of non-payment; application for commitment/license suspension
JOC
undecided

Called at 9:54 AM. Also called 13CT30 and 14CF106. Sterling Soman appears in person and in custody with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Chrles Simono. State - disposing of all matters today. Joy - NC on 13CT30 - joint of 45 dys in FC jail, AODA assessment, IID, $762.00 fine, 12 month DL revocation; 14CF79 - amend #4 to misd BJ and plead G to amended #4 and other counts to be DRI, recommends 90 days jail - concurrent to 14CF106 and consecutive to 13CT30; 14CF106 - amend #1 to 346.04(2T) - plead G - 90 days jail, consecutive to 14CF79 and consecutive to 13CT30. State agrees. Soman agrees. Court - 13CT30 - Soman pleads G to count #1 as alleged, 14CF79 - court amends #4 to mids bail contrary to 946.49(1a) - reads new charge and penalty - pleads G, court dismisses and reads in remaining counts; 14CT106 - amends count #1 to attempting to elude traffic officer contrary to 346.04(2t) - pleads G - dismisses and reads in remaining counts. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State proviedes court with documentation that a UTV will be surrendered to City of Crandon as part of the plea deal - Joy and Soman agree and understand. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asking for a furlough in the near future to attend inpatient treatment - credit for 42 days on 14CT79 and no credit on 13CT30 (8/10/14 to present) - requests huber for school/treatment. Soman makes statement. Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections, sentences the defendant to the following: 13CT30 - 45 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - stayed if participates in inpatient alcohol drug treatment program - upon successful completion of treatment - must be transported back to FC jail, AODA and follow thru, IID on DL and any vehicle titled in his name for 1 year commencing upon issuance of valid DL, 1 year DL revocation, $762.00 fine - 10 DTP/CO - consecutive to jail time; 14CF79 - count #4 - 90 days in FC jail - credit for 42 days - consecutive to 13CT30 - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), costs - 30 DTP/CO; 14CF106 - #1 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to 14CF79 and consecutive to 13CT30 - credit for 42 days - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), costs - 30 DTP/CO, right to appeal, adjourned.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No consumption of alcohol. Court will allow a furlough for the defendant to go to inpatient treatment and can be taken from the Forest County Jail to treatment center and directly back to the Forest County Jail upon completion of inpatient treatment.

Called at 2:17 PM. Also called 13CT30 and 14CF79. Sterling Soman appears in person and in custody with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. Joy has new complaint (14CF106), waives reading, waives time limits. Joy - bond - asks for reduction in bond so that the defendant can attend Koinonia. State responds - objects to bond reduction for stated reasons and requests increase in bond to $8,000.00. Joy responds - sticks to request for reduction in bond.  Court - bond - sets bond to $5000.00 cash on this matter with same conditions and will allow furlough for the defendant to go to inpatient treatment and can be taken from the jail to the treatment center and directly back to the jail upon completion of inpatient treatment. Court sets this matter for PH on 9/11/14 at 2:15 PM. 14CF79 - continue bond and set for PH on 9/14/14 at 2:30 PM. Court continues bond on this matter and allows same furlough condition. 13CT30 - Joy makes sure there is a NG plea on file for this matter, asks for furlough condition on this bond as well, set matter for STC on 9/11/14 at 2:30 PM. Court will set the matter for a JT on 9/22/14 at 8:30 AM, Court sets bond at $2500.00 cash with same conditions and furlough conditions as well.
No consumption of alcohol
Adjourned initial appearance on August 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Called at 10:56 AM. Sterling Soman appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Jodi Bednar Clemens. Soman has complaint. Court reviews court record, asks where his attorney is. Soman - tried calling him this morning and has not heard from him. Court sets the matter for 8/27/14 for AIA  at 10:00 AM, defendant instructed to contact Joy again. State - bond - $3000 cash bond for stated reasons. Court - $3000 cash bond with same conditions as previously set.

Prior: P.O. Box 85, Crandon, WI 54520 United States
Adjourned initial appearance on August 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Arrested FOSO

Called at 3:15 PM. Sterling Soman does not appear nor does any attorney on his behalf. State appears by JBC. Clerk informed court that he called several times informing that he was going to be late due to not having a ride and then called again to state that he was almost here. Court issues bench warrant, body or $500.00.

ADDRESS INFO for Sterling L Soman
Current: P.O. Box 85, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 07-09-2014)
Prior: 600 West Broad Street, Crandon, WI 54520
No consumption of alcohol
Adjourned initial appearance on July 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 9:20 AM. Sterling Soman does not appear nor does any attorney on his behalf. State appears by Charles Simono. State - mailed S&C and not returned, request warrant, body or $1000. Court issues bench warrant, body or $1000.00. Recalled at 10:49 AM. Sterling Soman now appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Soman has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Soman understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can afford his own (Jeff Joy). Court sets aside warrant that was previously issued, sets for AIA on 7/16/14 at 9:00 AM. State - bond - $1000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol. Court so orders.
